tunnel.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through
tunnel.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the Channel Tunnel  (=between England and France)
tunnel.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a passage under the ground that animals have dug to live in
tunnel.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: A 250-metre-long tunnel provides access to all parts of the development.
He peered uneasily down the dark tunnel at the end of the platform.
She ran down the narrow tunnel leading to the exit.
The prisoners escaped through an underground tunnel.
a road tunnel through the mountains
They went by train via the Channel Tunnel.
The roof of the tunnel was a foot above his head.
the entrance to a tunnel/tunnel entrance
To the right was the entrance to a second tunnel.
Burglars had dug a tunnel under the building in an attempted raid.
The contractors will start building the tunnel next month.
The Greenwich Foot Tunnel leads under the River Thames.
tunnel.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to dig a long passage under the ground
tunnel.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: They were tunnelling into the mountainside.
The prisoners tunneled their way under the fence.
tunnel.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if insects tunnel into something, they make holes in it
tunnel.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The grubs tunnel into the wood.
